did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.repository: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Center.
did.abstract: A small collection consisting of photocopies of several letters and one document written by Samuel Willard in 1816. Location of the originals is unknown.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Samuel Willard, presumably of Connecticut, wrote to a brother in Ashford, Connecticut, and to another gentleman in Stafford, Connecticut. The tone of the correspondence implies that Mr. Willard was in some sort of legal difficulty but it is not clear what his specific problems were.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains several letters and one document written by Samuel Willard in March 1816.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has materials pertaining to individuals living in Northeastern Connecticut throughout the 19th century. For information about specific collections, contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Until the location of the originals is determined materials should be cited as follows: [Item, Folder #], Samuel Willard Papers. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The photocopies of the letters were donated by the staff of the Rhode Island Historical Society in 2003. The collection was never accessioned by the RIHS or included in any listing of holdings of that institution.
